name: Aurelia Validation Alpha 2
description: We're excited to announce the release of aurelia-validation alpha 2! This release is a complete overhaul of the validation system.
content:
We're excited to announce the release of aurelia-validation alpha 2! This release is a complete overhaul of the validation system.

There are a **ton** of new features and usability improvements. Here's the short list:

* First-Class TypeScript Support
* Asynchronous Validation
* Full API Documentation and Articles
* "Entity" Style Validation
* Conditional Validation
* Easy definition of custom rules
* Easy customization of validation messages
* Internationalization Support
* Remove external dependencies (validate.js)
* and much more...

We couldn't have done this without all your feedback and support from community members like Jason Sobell. Many thanks!

Head over to the [Aurelia Hub](http://aurelia.io/hub.html#/doc/article/aurelia/validation/latest/validation-basics) to read about how to get started and explore the capabilities of `aurelia-validation`. Looking for more information? Check out this series of blog posts written by Jason: [part 1](http://www.sobell.net/aurelia-validation/), [part 2](http://www.sobell.net/aurelia-validation-part-2/) and [part 3](http://www.sobell.net/aurelia-validation-part-3-custom-rules-and-validations/).

As always, if you find an issue or have an idea for an enhancement, drop us a line on [GitHub](https://github.com/aurelia/validation/issues).
Questions? Check out the [aurelia-validation Gitter channel](https://gitter.im/aurelia/validation). Much thanks to core team member Jeremy Danyow who has been spearheading the effort!
